article.title: Overdensities of SMGs around WISE-selected, ultra-luminous, high-redshift AGN

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 illustrate about the relationship between the redshift and the number of companion submillimetre sources found around WISE-selected AGNs?
choices: There is a positive correlation between redshift and the number of companion sources.
There is a negative correlation between redshift and the number of companion sources.
There is no clear correlation between redshift and the number of companion sources.
The data is inconclusive as there are not enough data points for Hot DOGs.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from Figure 3 about the surface number density of SMGs in Hot DOG and WISE/radio AGN fields compared to previous submm surveys?
choices: The surface number density of SMGs is lower in Hot DOG and WISE/radio AGN fields.
The surface number density of SMGs is similar in Hot DOG and WISE/radio AGN fields compared to other surveys.
The surface number density of SMGs is higher in Hot DOG and WISE/radio AGN fields, indicating overdensity.
The figure does not provide information about the surface number density of SMGs in these fields.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 4 suggest about the angular clustering signal of companion sources around WISE/radio AGNs compared to previous studies on SMGs?
choices: The WISE/radio AGN fields show stronger clustering than previously observed in SMGs.
The WISE/radio AGN fields show similar clustering strength to previous studies on SMGs.
The WISE/radio AGN fields show a weaker clustering signal, imposing an upper limit to previous findings.
The figure does not provide sufficient data to compare clustering signals between WISE/radio AGNs and previous SMG studies.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula, SFR850µm = 200 × S850µm, is used to estimate what property of SMGs with z > 1.5?
